reviews.sentence: The hotel is quite a way out of town but has some wonderful views across the valleys below. On first impressions the hotel reception is stunning but the rooms look tired and the bathrooms very old although the shower is good. Breakfast is disappointing and the prices for drinks can be eye watering 2 coffees and 2 30ml cans of Amstel cost 24JD. There was some construction decorating being done which meant the pool was out of bounds too. If I came back I would try somewhere closer to town.

Our visit. Great Hotel with wonderful views. Two double beds in the rooms. Staff so helpful and friendly. Food was wonderful. We had trouble with our travel company regarding BB status when we had booked half board which this hotel sorted out for us quickly with the minimum of fuss. Loved staying here.

Extremely welcoming staff. The hotel seems to have been refurnished for the better however some of the constructions seem to be unfinished like the door hinges and the drains that needs some extra work. The restaurant is on the lower floor with a pretty courtyard. The food offered is not diverse but of good quality really liked the fish. The staff is extremely welcoming and warming to the guests. The hotel offers free wifi. And one thing that I have to mention is that the comforter is some of the most soft that I have ever slept in. Such a treat. 20 minutes away from Petra but situated on the slopes makes the view greater. Make sure to see the sunset and leave a good impression.

Table drinks were not offered by the restaurant staff. Only on request. The rooms are partly renovated unfortunately we had an old shabby room caught. Conclusion. Der Service i m Restaurant ist gut. Tischgetränke wurden vom Restaurant Personal nicht angeboten. Nur auf Anfrage. Die Zimmer sind teilweise renoviert leider haten wir ein altes abgewohntes Zimmer erwischt. Fazit Wir sind nicht verhungert.

I would not go backOriginalRegular tuvimos problema con el agua del baño dos días la amabilidad del director fue darnos una botela de agua mineral. No volvería.

Dirty moldy outdated not deserving of any stars. This facility has promise as you enter the lobby but it all goes downhill quickly thereafter. This hotel does not live up to Movenpick or any other branded hotel standards. Carpeting stained bathrooms moldy cigarette burns in bedding hair in carpeting also was locked in room without telephone service. Very unsafe hotel.

NO DONT. How can Movenpick give it is name to such a facility. We were there for just one night with a group of friends and every single one of us had a miserable time. The rooms were small dirty and the bathrooms could do with a good cleaning. Toilets that do not flush was really the least of the problems. One bathroom had cold water pouring down from the ceiling when the shower was used. One couple was locked in their room for 2 hours before they could get out when the door had to be dislodged through sheer brute force by the technicians that came. The poor quality of the food at dinner and at breakfast pales against this experience except that a number ended up with upset tummies. And they were I am told running a full house.

Complete opposite of 5 stars. First time staying at a Mövenpick and based on this experience also the last. After we arrived and checked in at around 1630 we discovered that the hotel is undergoing major renovations which meant construction noise dust smells everywhere. These were very prevalent in our corridor which meant that we could not have an afternoon nap. We also found that there were no safes in the room nor anywhere to hang wet towels. Although it seemed like our room had recently been renovated the building standards were shoddy at best and some of the fixtures were poorly installed. Instead we decided to have a drink and were informed by reception that this would not be possible because the bar only opens at 1830. After pointing out that this is not really how a 5star hotel operates there was only a shrug of the shoulders and an indication that there would be an effort to find the barman. After waiting for about 15 minutes I went to reception but found it empty. I also knocked on the managers door but there was no response. After a while more we were eventually served by a very surly barman although the drinks order was correct. At dinner we were horrified to discover that some of the food was just warmed up leftovers from previous days especially noticeable with the roast potatoes and desserts. However some of the food was actually quite tasty but the service was also pretty poor by some of the waiters. The next morning we reported a blown light bulb and found it in the same state when we returned from our day trip that afternoon. Also while trying to make tea we had to move furniture to find the plug and discovered a pile of dust which did not say much about the attention to details of housekeeping. The shower was a lukewarm affair and for a change dinner did not seem to include warmed up leftovers although it seems no one knows how to roast potatoes in that kitchen. The service was also much better on the second evening due to different staff on duty. At breakfast on our last day we again found that the usual pastries were stale at least a day old if not more. At checkout the credit card paypoints were not working which was an issue for us to settle our bill. Other than the comfortable beds and clean rooms there is very little that can redeem this hotel and the fault is squarely on the management. Even if the building standards were top notch the lack of leadership means poor staff training and therefore poor service. The entire managerial staff should be retrained or replaced if there is any hope of improving the service at the hotel I suggest they spend one night at the W Amman to experience a real 5star hotel. In any case the hotel should not be accepting bookings during major renovations. In 11 years of travels this was by far the worst hotel experience we have ever had. Even if this was a once off it really does not reflect well on the Mövenpick group. From now on we will make sure to avoid this hotel group.

Outdated. The room was far below the quality we expected from a movenpick hotel. The rooms were large but the bathroom was small. The cranes were rusty and difficult to handle. The bathroom was not entirely clean neither the towels. A positive note was that we had rooms with connecting doors but it was very clear that during our visit 3 nights to cleaning was done between those doors while it was obvious it was needed. So we were in doubt if the rest of our room was decently cleaned. The breakfast and dinner were decent. There is room for improvement in the service the overall cleaning of the complete building and the acomodation it needs complete renovation.

Very simple rooms it is a 3 star in a beautiful building. The staff can get to demand tipOriginalEs muy bonito pero la comida es bastante lamentable o bajas a cenar a primera hora o te tomas la sopa fría no reponen la fruta. Las habitaciones muy simples. es un 3 estrelas en un edificio precioso. El personal puede legar a exigir propina.

Good. Great views over Petra mountains. Very big and clean room though furniture a bit on the old style. Staff was very nice. Food quality not up to a supposedly 5 star hotel standard both at breakfast and at the dinner buffet.
Beautiful location the views are stunning. A bit out of the way bar was very pricey. Breakfast was good a nice selection.

Quiet hotel with good views but not a 5. If it was peak season the location of the hotel would be nice to get away from the crowds however off season it was almost deserted. There are good views across the valley. A car is needed if you are going to stay this far from the town although there is a shuttle. The room was fairly large and comfortable with tea coffee and water available. Staff were helpful with requests. The hotel is either still under construction or falling apart could not tell which. Nearby the pool the glass door of the emergency exit was smashed all over the floor. The breakfast was not up to standard. The main bar and the restaurant were closed but drinks food could be obtained from the library or room service.
Translated by Google. It is a beautiful and large hotel with a fantastic view and a perfect serviceOriginalفندق جميل وكبير وفيه مطل رائع وخدمه مثاليه.

Quiet nice view far away from the hustle bustle. Quiet good location with beautiful view good food for breakfast convenient if you have a rental car. The welcoming staff could have given more information about Petra. They did not mention that Petra Museum is amazing.

Very good hotel drive to Petra. Hotel is modern and clean. Rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast is very good Only downside is location a good ten to fifteen minutes from the main gate by bus. There is a shuttle bus provided. Worth considering.
Nice hotel and very clean room friendly housekeeping staff.
The room is clean in addition to the excellent room service. This thing made me love this place.

Great views room food and service. I stayed only one night here over the Christmas period as part of a group tour. Check in was quick easy. The room was large with a huge bed and even a pillow menu and the bathroom was big too with a very good shower no bath. The dinner buffet meal had plenty of variety. I had a harty Jordanian stew type meal that was very good. there is also plenty of fruit veg breads and great desserts. The breakfast buffet was also very good with heaps of variety. YOU MUST TRY THE HOT CHOCOLATE OUT OF THE AUTOMATIC MACHINE. Great views of the sunset over Petra and the sunshine onto Petra in the mornings from the deck viewing platform outside the dining room. Overall a comfortable stay with great food service. I had have no problem staying here again.
